meanings.definition: To divide into small pieces or portions.
meanings.sent1: She morseled the cake into tiny slices for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: The chef morseled the ingredients carefully before adding them to the pot.
meanings.sent3: The children morseled the puzzle into small sections to make it easier to solve.
meanings.sent4: The artist morseled the canvas with different colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher morseled the story into parts to help the students understand it better.

meanings.definition: A small piece or portion of food.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed every morseled of the delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: The plate was filled with various morseled of appetizers for the party.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gathered morseled of nuts to store for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The buffet offered a variety of morseled for the guests to sample.
meanings.sent5: The child eagerly reached for the last morseled of candy on the table.
